text: Went for a light lunch after church on Sunday and found the place pleasantly empty. I was concerned it would be crowded with the brunch crowd. Had a great time chatting with my wife. Nicely redone from the previous cafe with full length glass panels so light filled and serene. Food is usual B&C fare. Like the beetroot energy salad, very refreshing.

Came to this lovely place to meet my wife's client for an appointment. The bread, pastries and drink selection look amazing! I ate a wonderful chocolate eclair paired with a nice pot of green tea. The combination was wonderful. I am a disabled person and needed to use the toilet, the friendly staff Nicholas kindly and patiently guided me to the toilet outside the cafe and also opened the door for me. I had a great experience with this cafe and I wholly recommend it to everybody who appreciates great bakes and tea!

A hidden gem amongst the quiet neighborhood , came here on a weekday and there were a few groups but plenty of open spots to just hang out and chill. Parking sometimes could be a challenge as limited to street side parking

Came here a couple of times. Opens early and very quiet in the morning and gets rather busy by brunch. Decent croissants, kouign amman rather disappointing. Had a collab with Plank offering sourdough pizza, which is a tad salty. Service could definitely be better

Happy to find Baker & Cook at Eng Kong Park where i take only 5-6 mins to walk there ü§© Met Zac who is so friendly and made my first trip to this restaurant so welcoming üëçüèº will definitely visit this restaurant for weekend brunch üëçüèºüòã
